title-group.article-title: Weak Order for the Discretization of the Stochastic Heat Equation

abstract.p: In this paper we study the approximation of the distribution of <tex-math>$X_t $</tex-math> Hilbert-valued stochastic process solution of a linear parabolic stochastic partial differential equation written in an abstract form as <tex-math>$dX_t + AX_t \,dt = Q^{1/2} dW(t)$</tex-math> , <tex-math>$X_0 = x \in H$</tex-math> , <tex-math>$t \in [0,T]$</tex-math> driven by a Gaussian space time noise whose covariance operator Q is given. We assume that A⁻α is a finite trace operator for some α > 0 and that Q is bounded from H into <tex-math>$D(A^\beta )$</tex-math> for some β > 0. It is not required to be nuclear or to commute with A. The discretization is achieved thanks to finite element methods in space (parameter h > 0) and a θ-method in time (parameter Δt = T/N). We define a discrete solution <tex-math>$X_h^n $</tex-math> and for suitable functions φ defined on H, we show that <tex-math>$\left| {E\phi (X_h^N ) - E\phi (X_T )} \right| = O(h^{2\gamma } + \Delta t^\gamma )$</tex-math> where γ < 1 - α + β. Let us note that as in the finite dimensional case the rate of convergence is twice the one for pathwise approximations.
